page.title: 09LIVERPOOL AIRPORT (cont)
page.content:
Liverpool Corporation and the new improved 7,500 ft. runway is capable of handling all types of aircraft. From 1974,the airport has been run by the Merseyside County Council. It is fair to say that Speke has suffered from the close proximity to Manchester International Airport, but there are regular daily flights to Heathrow and Gatwick, Isle of Man and Ireland, as well as numerous freight and charter flights, including the nightly mail plane service, which involves planes going to fifteen U.K. destinations as part of the Post Offices movement of mail.
Written by C.H.Elwood and class 4E,Stocktonwood Juniors.
